meanings.definition: Lose or be deprived of as a penalty for wrongdoing or neglect.
meanings.sent1: He was forfeiting his allowance for not completing his chores.
meanings.sent2: She risked forfeiting her prize by breaking the competition rules.
meanings.sent3: The cat was forfeiting its nap time for a chance to chase a butterfly.
meanings.sent4: By skipping practice, he was forfeiting his shot at winning the championship.
meanings.sent5: The student knew that forfeiting his homework meant facing the consequences.

meanings.definition: Surrender or give up something as a result of a rule or agreement.
meanings.sent1: They were forfeiting their seats on the bus to accommodate other passengers.
meanings.sent2: The team decided to forfeit the match, forfeiting their chance at victory.
meanings.sent3: She was forfeiting her dessert as part of a bet with her friend.
meanings.sent4: The company was forfeiting its profits to support a charitable cause.
meanings.sent5: He was forfeiting his turn in the game to help a teammate who was struggling.
